001/**
002 * Represents an order containing multiple order items
003 * @author Shruti Oruganti
004*/
005package src.model;
006
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.List;
009
010/**
011 * Represents a customer's order, which may contain multiple ordeitems objects.
012 * Provides methods to manage items and calculate the subtotal of the order.
013 */
014public class order {
015    private List<order_item> items = new ArrayList<>();
016    private int orderId;
017
018    /**
019     * Retrieves the list of items in the order.
020     * @return - A list of orderitem objects in this order
021     */
022    public List<order_item> getItems() { 
023        return items; 
024    }
025
026    /**
027     * Adds an item to the order.
028     * @param item - The orderitem to add
029     */
030    public void addItem(order_item item) { 
031        items.add(item); 
032    }
033
034    /**
035     * Retrieves the order ID.
036     * @return - The unique identifier for this order
037     */
038    public int getId() { 
039        return orderId; 
040    }
041
042    /**
043     * Sets the order ID.
044     * @param orderId - The unique identifier to assign to this order
045     */
046    public void setId(int orderId) { 
047        this.orderId = orderId; 
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Calculates the subtotal of the order by summing the prices of all items.
052     * @return - The subtotal price of all orderitem objects in the order
053     */
054    public double getSubtotal() {
055        double subtotal = 0;
056        for (order_item item : items) {
057            subtotal += item.getPrice();
058        }
059        return subtotal;
060    }
061}
